thread.title: Boxing fans online outraged after issues with Sky stream for David Haye vs Tony Bellow
thread.title_full: Boxing fans online outraged after issues with Sky stream for David Haye vs Tony Bellow

author: Jim Daly
title: Boxing fans online outraged after issues with Sky stream for David Haye vs Tony Bellow
text:
Boxing fans online outraged after issues with Sky stream for David Haye vs Tony Bellow "Bloody BoxOffice! Hope I've not just wasted £16.95!" Share Some viewers had problems watching Haye vs Bellew via the Sky Box Office (Photo: PA) Share Get daily updates directly to your inbox + Subscribe Thank you for subscribing! Could not subscribe, try again later Invalid Email 
The David Haye vs Tony Bellew fight hadn't even started and some boxing fans were already up in arms. 
Fans hoping to watch the game via the Sky Box Office stream online faced lots of issues and took to social media to display their frustration. 
That included cricket legend Kevin Peitersen who tweeted that his stream wasn't working after shelling out £16.95 to watch the fight. 
And he wasn't the only one... (Photo: PA) 
Sky's Twitter help account started offering refunds for viewers having problems watching. 
Viewers could, though, have legally tuned in thanks to a special offer run by Sky Bet . 
Fight fans were able to sign up to the bookmaker as a new customer, opt in and stake a £5 bet on any boxing market with minimum odds of 1/2 by 5.30pm on Saturday. (Photo: PA) 
And if you're having problems with the Sky Box Office you can follow all the action with our Mirror Sport live blog right here . (Photo: REUTERS)
